sshkey

Methods for interacting with the SSH key endpoints
https://www.vultr.com/api/#sshkey

Methods

create(parameters)

Create a new SSH Key.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#sshkey_create
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
name string <optional>
 Name of the SSH key.
ssh_key string SSH public key (in authorized_keys format).
Source:
  • sshkey.js, line 20

delete(parameters)

Remove a SSH key. Note that this will not remove the key from any machines that already have it.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#sshkey_destroy
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
SSHKEYID string Unique identifier for this SSH key.
Source:
  • sshkey.js, line 46

list()

List all the SSH keys on the current account.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#sshkey_sshkey_list
Source:
  • sshkey.js, line 7

update(parameters)

Update an existing SSH Key. Note that this will only update newly installed machines. The key will not be updated on any existing machines.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#sshkey_update
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
SSHKEYID string Unique identifier for this SSH key.
name string <optional>
 New name for the SSH key.
ssh_key string <optional>
 New SSH key contents.
Source:
  • sshkey.js, line 67
